ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Race of study subject
ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

ElementDescription: Ethnicity of participant
ValueRange: Hispanic or Latino; Not Hispanic or Latino; Unknown

ElementDescription: Phenotype/diagnosis for the subject
Proband's NDAR GUID. Proband=child with Autism or other condition, which is a Study primary intererest group
The relationship of this individual to the Proband
ValueRange: Proband; Self; Mother; Father; Sibling; Other; Nonbiological mother; Nonbiological father

ElementDescription: The parents of this individual are consanguinous
Description of parental consanguinous relationship
Has the subject been diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder?
Details of ASD diagnosis
Has the subject been diagnosed with Developmental Disorder?
Details of DD diagnosis
Does (did) the subject have Attention Deficit Disorder +/- Hyperactivity?
This individual meets DSMIV criteria for autistic disorder
This individual has had an IQ test
Name of IQ test given to participant
IQ score as defined by the completion of an appropriate assessement
Has any other developmental test been done?
Details of other developmental tests
Seizures
Notes: NK= Not known; NS = Not sure

ElementDescription: Details of the seizure history and/or type(s)
This individual has a head circumference smaller than 2 standard deviations below the mean for gender and age
This individual has a head circumference larger than 2 standard deviations above the mean for gender and age
Details of head circumference
Hearing Loss: Does (did) the subject have Hearing loss?
Details of the hearing loss
Vision:  Does (did) the subject have Vision/eye problems?
Details of the vision problem
This individual been diagnosed with another neurologic problem(s)
Details of the other neurologic problem(s)
Did the subject take a EEG exam?
Details of EEG result(s)
Did the subject take a CT scan of brain?
Details of the head CT result(s)
Did the subject take an MRI scan of brain?
Details of the brain MRI result(s)
Details of other phenotype(s)
